intro: Psychotria cabuyarensis, commonly known as the Cabuyare psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, specifically Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
